intro: Lappula parvula, commonly known as small lappula, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its seeds are small and dry, adapted for dispersal by wind. Lappula parvula is considered an annual herb, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
